alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 15 at 8:06PM CDT until May 15 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN SEQUOYAH...SOUTHERN ADAIR AND SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 806 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Adair State Park to 3 miles north of Bunch to 2 miles south of Cookson, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Stilwell... Marble City... Cookson... Brushy Lake State Park... Adair State Park... Brushy... Bunch... Short... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma near mile marker 316. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
